summary: Diff adds a Motoko backend actor with data types for jobs, candidates, interviews, clients, and user profiles plus an authorization/access-control mixin; frontend adds II-based auth hook, React Router navigation/pages scaffolding, themed layout/header/sidebar, React Query hooks for backend calls, and UI components including empty-state illustration and profile setup dialog. Several requested capabilities may exist in omitted/truncated files, so only clear deviations are flagged.

hallucinated_features.description: Admin bootstrap via secret URL parameter (caffeineAdminToken) and backend initialization call _initializeAccessControlWithSecret
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest does not mention any secret-token based admin initialization/bootstrapping mechanism; only requires Internet Identity login with Admin/Staff roles managed by backend.

hallucinated_features.description: Caffeine.ai promotional footer link and branding
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest does not request any third-party attribution/footer link; this is additional UI behavior/content.
evidence: frontend/src/components/AppLayout.tsx (footer includes link to `https://caffeine.ai/...` and marketing text)

hallucinated_features.description: Forced user profile setup dialog capturing name/email and storing a `role` field in profile data
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest requires roles stored by backend and default Staff unless set by Admin, but does not require collecting/storing name/email via a mandatory profile-setup modal before app use.
evidence: frontend/src/App.tsx (shows ProfileSetupDialog when profile is null)

hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest asks for a consistent theme but does not request next-themes integration specifically; this appears to be extra implementation detail (and in the shown snippet, unused).
